tweets.text: We‚Äôre back https://t.co/zyWbXErl0m

Moscow's infrastructure is not able to handle the <50mm of rain that's falling today. Subway stations have been flooded, roofs & cranes have collapsed & one suburb lost electricity after lightning hit a transformer https://t.co/HKBKetWtSU https://t.co/gbytKQnu3T

"Not all the species commercial whalers once hunted appear to be recovering, even with long-term protection measures." 
A lot of nuance in this piece. Great job @Lhm3Lauren 
The hopeful return of polar whales https://t.co/rdGJTARdHN via @ConversationUK

This enormous monstrosity is the world's first floating nuclear power plant. 

It's about to start operating in the Russian Arctic. 

No joke. This is a real thing. 

#NuclearTitanic  https://t.co/ptuIamPZuh

The first ever @PAMESecretariat #workshop under the project to develop a framework for more systematically engaging with @ArcticCouncil #Observers on #shipping related work just started 

Heavy agenda ahead!

#maritime #Arctic #cooperation #London https://t.co/wWRNbAbbq1
Polar powers: Russia‚Äôs bid for supremacy in the Arctic Ocean https://t.co/hp3lvDU89y
Russia revamps Arctic military base to stake claim on region https://t.co/2JKJGzRcHo #hw #cdnpoli https://t.co/Eq4mCBj4jY

‚ÄúThe fact that you can now ship with a container ship through the Arctic along the Northern Sea Route, when even just 10 years ago that was not even remotely possible, shows shows how quickly and how dramatically climate change is affecting the region." https://t.co/LiEr68u47O

We've mapped every ship in the Arctic & Bering Strait over 7 years... by far the biggest vector dataset I've ever worked with.  Still struggling however with how to display the data.  This animation shows well the annual mean center shift of shipping activity N and E over time. https://t.co/g78N5jbJkJ
The most bizarre idea of 2018 #IceWatchLondon ‚Å¶@Tate‚Å© https://t.co/IpNAcAyahQ
The Arctic's 'last bastion' of sea ice is breaking up for the first time on record - CNN https://t.co/bvbci6VCXZ

Can‚Äôt believe we didn‚Äôt listen to Michael Jackson warning us about climate change in 1995 with the Earth song. Now here we all are, boiling ourselves to death in a hot jacket potato of a globe like idiots.

urls.title: Oil industry wants government to build seawall to protect refineries from climate change effects
urls.description: A publicly funded proposal would build a 60-mile barrier on the Texas coast to protect against storms and higher tides.

tweets.text:
I swear to you, this headline is not from @TheOnion. It's real.
